name: The Absent Rule
flavor: As the Argo leaves the Knossos port, you look to the Horned City one last time. Not many have come to see you off, but a glint from the palace confirms your suspicions: spying eyes are set upon you.
The Cretans delivered fuel and supplies as promised. Enough to subsist, but only jusy. Is it all they could spare, or a short leash? Either way, you should stick to the coast.
Without much to go on, you fall back on the basics: scout the island, question the locals
rulesTitle: Collect Progress

abilityText.value: If you skipped the Tutorial, create the Cycle I exploration deck: find Cycle I Exploration cards 1-9, 13, 19, 23, and 28-32, and shuffle them
Take the Cycle I Map tile
and place it on the table
Place the Argo on that tile
Proceed to the first step of the Campaign Round
To progress through the story you must gather
token either on the current Story card or on the Inward Odyssey card
tokens on this card, flip the card to side 1B

flavor2: Minos is a hard man to find. The scraps of information you do manage to uncover inevitably lead to a dead end: a missing fisherman, a burned down temple, a murdered philosopher. It doesn't help that the Minoans are not as forthcoming as you would like. It seems the king held the island in too tight a grip, and there are many who would prefer him to remain missing.
A lesser crew would give up on this fruitless search. But not you. Even the absence of clues is in itself a clue. Someone has been covering their tracks.

There's talk of foreigners supposedly looking for the same prize you're after. Not far from your current position, atop a mount on an artificial island, stands an unfinished Cretan wonder known to some as the City of the Bull. Construction halted when the Great Mourning began--yet now there are rumors of foreign ships coming and going under the cover of night.
It might be prudent to pay it a visit
rulesTitle2: Reach the City of the Bull

abilityText.value: Place the City of the Bull marker on the closest unoccupied
symbols on the Map, place the marker on thisc ard instead
Then, when you reveal a Map tile with a
symbol, immediately place the City of the Bull marker on that
covered by the City of the Bull marker
is on the Mpa tile with the City of the Bull marker, during the Story Step, see 0002

name: A Fateful Randezvous
flavor: It seems King Minos may have found himself some new friends in this "Symmachy" you've been hearing about. But to choose foreign power over his own daughters? Strange and ominous. Eitehr something is rotten at the core of the Minoan Dynasty... or Minos was taken prisoner and the Symmachy are using old animosities to stir the already boiling pot that is Crete.
Either way, this "Symmachy" is involved and your mission remains the same. You concentrate your efforts on finding the foreign ship, the Marathonian
rulesTitle: Collect Progress and follow the clues

abilityText.value: When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge
Take the four Story 2A Clue cards and shuffle the,
token on this card, draw one of the four 2A Clue cards and return the rest to the box
You need to find the Map tile shown on the card
Correctly match the clue from the card to the clue on the Map tile to find what to do next!
They may come in handy later
Alternatively, you may wish to learn more about the

flavor2: The Symmachy flagship has fled upriver. You're not sure what their plan is or how far the Argo can sail in shallow waters, but you have little choise: Minos is on that ship. Willingly or not, he will come with you, and you will be done with this cursed island once and for all.

You give pursuit. Even a few miles inland, the landscape starts to change, become more angular, more... artificial. Your scouts reported as much, but seeing this with your own eyes, hills slowly turning into stepped terraces like the Egyptain pyramids, or peach and persimmon trees bearing cube-shaped fruit, is something else.
Crete is being remade and seemingly nothing can stop it.
You must find Minos
rulesTitle2: Catch up to the Flagship

abilityText.value: Find the ten Story 2B Clue cards, set aside the
Then randomly remove a number of these Clue cards equal to the number of
tokens you had on Story 2A and return them to the box (without looking)
card with the remaining Clue cards to create the Pursuit deck
symbol in the bottom right corner), during the Story Step, draw 1 card from the Pursuit deck and resolve it, then remove it form the game (return it to the box)

name: A Phantom Thread
flavor: Your meeting with the Symmachy has left you with more questions than answers. You have no reason to believe anything Militiades said--but you could say the same about the about the Minoan Dynasty. The only difference is, Minos's daughters hold the keys to the Daedalus Vault, wherein you hope to find parts to fix the Argo. Or so they claim.

From what you've learned, Minos, if he is still alive, is heading for the grave of Ariadne at the Sepulcher Acropolis. The Acropolis is hidden, but Daedalus, its builder, left clues to its location at several sites across Crete.
Thankfully, you've got a map
rulesTitle: Locate the Sepulcher Acropolis

abilityText.value: When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge
Take the five Story 3A Clue cards and shuffle them to create the Temple deck
is on a Map tile with the Minotaur Temple symbol, during the Story Step, you may search it by drawing and resolving a card from the Temple deck
If the card shows any coordinates, these coordinates are forever tied to the Map tile they were drawn on
You can search each Minotaur Temple only once
Note searched Temples in the Map section of the Argo Sheet
Resolve the effects below when you place the designeated number of
: Reveal the top card from the Temple deck and discard it
This is not considered drawing a card
: Reveal the top card from the Temple deck and discard it
This is not considered drawing a card
: Draw the top card from the Temple deck and resolve it
When you find the full set of coordinates of the Sepulcher Acropolis, turn this card to side 3B

flavor2: You've traveled Crete far and wide, uncovering cryptic clues left by the Great Inventor, Daedalus. Many a time you've asked yourselves: why hide a necropolis? Why leave clues leading to it? For whom?

Maybe Minos will be able to provide some answers.... once you find him. If he's alive. As you put together the fragmented information from the many Minotaur Temples visited, you pinpoint the location of the Sepulcher Acropolis.
You set your course
rulesTitle2: Reach the Sepulcher Acropolis

abilityText.value: Place the Sepulcher Acropolis marker on the Map tile shown by the coordinates
If it is unexplored, place the marker on this card instead
Then, when you reveal the Map tile designated by the coordinates, immediately place the Sepulcher Acropolis marker on this tile
is on the same Map tile as the Sepulcher Acropolis marker, during the Story Step, see 0075

name: Unappealable Egress
flavor: There are many things that you still don't understand, but the hour grows late, and Crete's twilight is at hand. Soon there will be no way of stopping the reality-bending Truth. Minos is gone and with him, the true line of Minoan rulers seemingly ends. Your contract with the Minoan Dynasty cannot be fulfilled.

Ironically, the Sepulcher Acropolis housed the Daedalus Vault, the very place you've risked your neck for. With the parts found within, Alkabiades mends the Argo. You can finally leave this accursed island behind.
Yet you remain. For during your journey you've learned that mere survival is not enough. This world desperately needs hope heroes--and you will provide both. This is your purpose.
The Last Academy is creating a machina that will amplify the ontological field surrounding the grave of Ariadne and make the Temenos vulnerable. They call it Ariadne's Anchor.
You rush to Knossos to have a word with the self-proclaimed mouth of the Labyrinth, the Punished, now a prisoner of the Minoan Dynasty, to lure the creature out
rulesTitle: Collect Progress and reach Knossos

abilityText.value: When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge
If the Minoan Guide is with you, see 0089
If the Old Spinner is with you, immediately place 1
Exploration card from the Exploration deck (return it to the box)
You need to create the Ariadne's Anchor and rush back to Knossos
If the Argo is on the Knossos Map tile (027) and there are 5 or more
tokens on this card, the Anchor is complete
tokens on this card, flip to side 4B

flavor2: Ariande's Anchor is complete, with time to spare. The scholars of the Last Academy can perfect the design.The ontological field seems to have more properties than just anchoring an object to reality: some of the philosophers propose it may be used to conjure up a "theatre-like" reality environment, a waking dream to explore the endless possibilities of life. But that is for the future.
One day, the scholars find a giant xiphos lying on the floor of the Anchor's chamber, with no idea how it got there
rulesTitle2: Reach Knossos

abilityText.value: Technology card (unless you already have it)
Then, immediately go on an adventure from the Dreams Laid Bare hub (if you finished this hub already, choose another hub to go on an adventure from!)
With the Ariadne's Anchor upgraded and operational, it is time to head to Knossos
If the Argo is on the Knossos Map tile (027) and there are 5 or more
tokens on this card, the Anchor is complete

name: Inward Odyssey: Truth Of The Labyrinth
name2: Inward Odyssey: Truth Of The Labyrinth
flavor: You know precious little about the grand vessel you call home. Who built it? For what purpose? How did you come to be onboard?

There are vast spaces below deck, more than should be possible, even taking into account the massive size of the ship. Each day brings a new discovery, a new secret to be unraveled. Your Inward Odyssey has just begun

abilityText.value: tokens on this card, discard them and gain +1
level, during the Story Step, after all other Story events, resolve the corresponding Inward Odyssey adventure:
After you resolve the last adventure from this list, flip this card

flavor2: Your Inward Odyssey continues!

abilityText.value: tokens on this card, discard them and gain +1
level, during the Story Step, after all other Story events, resolve the corresponding Inward Odyssey adventure:

name: A Nietzschean Welcome
flavor: You have arrived in Lakonia, looking for answers about your origins. Instead, you've found death at the hands of Sparta's cruel, merciless leader, the Nietzschean.

The Nietzschean has issued you a challenge: reach the Temple of Man in 80 days and defeat him. Each day you linger, innocents will die, sacrificed to the new world order. You are the Argonauts. You will not let this stand.
To reach the Temple of Man, you need to navigate the empire's many rivers and canals, the Great River Works, and cross the sluice gates of the First Cataract.
And for that, you need an ignition key and a defector
rulesTitle: Collect Progress

abilityText.value: Create the Cycle II Exploration deck: find Cycle II Exploration cards 1-9, 13, 19, 23, 31, and 32 and shuffle them
Take the Cycle II Map tile
and place it on the table
Place the Argo on that tile
Proceed to the first step of the Campaign Round
tokens on this card, flip the card to side 1B

flavor2: The war rages on, and casualties mount. Even with enemies without and within, the Nietzschean empire is on the offensive. Each day brings new signs of misery: burned vullages and caravans of refugees.
You push forward.

Armed with an ignition key, you set your eyes on the First Cataract. There are four Sluice Gate Fortresses barring the way up north. The key you've recovered will grant you access to one of them. Luckily, you've got a map.
Now, to find a spy who will open it from within..
rulesTitle2: Find the correct Sluice Gate deck

abilityText.value: Take the four Story 1B Clue cards and shuffle the, to create the
Draw the top card and return the rest to the box
Reach the tile indicated by the card (it will include a waterway with the First Cataract Sluice Gate movement symbol)
When you enter the correct tile and have at least 1
, correctly match the clue card to the clue on the tile to begin your assault!

name: To Win The War
flavor: Your success at the Sluice Gate Fortress has emboldened your allies and disparate rebel groups across Lakonia. As the Argo cuts into Nietzschean territory beyond the First Cataract, and a whole nation rises in open revellion, the front lines are redrawn and the Symmachy gains initiative.
They deem the time has come to end the war with a quick, decisive victory...

The Nietzschean is said to travel between the outlying fortresses, inspecting the troops, which leaves you an opening. If you're able to pinpoint his location or learn of his itinerary, you'll be able to trap him inside a fortress and force him to battle on your terms.
Until that time, you need to build up Resistance in the region. It'll take a concerted effort from you and your allies to bring the tyrant down
rulesTitle: Find the Nietzschean's location and muster the rebel forces

abilityText.value: When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge
From this point onward, you can freely traverse
waterways with the First Cataract Sluice Gate Fortress
Note this on your Argo Sheet
) denote possible locations of the Nietzschean
Take the six 2A Clue cards and shuffle them
Whenever you win a Battle, draw 1 card from the Fortress deck and reveal it
Until the next Battle, the Nietzschean is at the last revealed location
This will become relevant when you progress to side 2B
When you lose a Battle, shuffle all revealed Fortress cards back into the deck
tokens placed on this card represent the strength of the Resistance in the region
tokens on this card, flip the card to side 2B

flavor2: As the giant Argo trudges through the ambrosia-contaminated canals of the Lakonian heartland, your allies gather in the Bridge Tholos to discuss the operation that will bring the Nietzschean down.

You've achieved so much in such a short amount of time, you can hardly believe it. And yet you dread facing the Nietzschean's monstrous shadow on the battlefield, as you still feel outclassed... yet this is it. You've located the Nietzschean and his Temple of Man citadel, and you've cut off all possible escape routes. It's time to call on your allies--on everyone who opposes the Spartan tyranny--and make the final push.
The bastard will pay for every drop of innocent blood he's spilled
rulesTitle2: Lay siege to the Fortress and put an end to the Nietzschean

abilityText.value: You do not draw any more Fortress cards: the Nietzschean is waiting at the last revealed location
If no Fortress card is currently revealed, draw one now
tokens placed on this card represent the strength of the Resistance in the region
on this card and you're on the correct tile with the Spartan Stronghold symbol, during the Story Step you may initiate the Siege of Sparta and see:

name: Argophylae
flavor: You're still reeling from the disaster that was the Battle at the Fortress. The Nietzschean baited you in and closed the trap behind you. He has sacrificed the entire stronghold to deal the revel forces a grave wound--one that they may not recover from.

As your allies scatter for safety, all the might of the Nietzschean empire bears down on the Argo. You thought yourselves untouchable in your gargantuan ship. Well, your enemy is right here to prove you wrong. Nothing is untouchable.

Cyclopean-forged chains have been strung from canal walls. Pursuit armadas of hunter-killer triremes snap at your heels. A barrage of harassment falls on you from above and below, from without and within, day and night, without reprieve. You're tired, broken, trapped.
Out of this gauntlet, you will emerge hardened--or not at all
rulesTitle: Escape the Argophylae trap and hide in a Resistance Haven

abilityText.value: When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge
Take the seven Story 3A Clue cards and shuffle them to create the
At the end of each Timeline Step, draw 1 card from this deck and resolve it
Place the Blockade token on the top space of the Blockade diagram on this card
You cannot move the Argo in the direction denoted by the Blockade token
At the end of each Movement Step, move the token 1 space clockwise
named in the 2B Story adventure (if you're not sure which, check the noted paragraph again and follow the instructions there)
If the Argophylae deck runs out of cards, shuffle it
If the Argophylae deck runs out of cards for the second time or the Argo is on a Map tile with a friendly Resistance Haven, during the Story Step see 0128

flavor2: You are the Argonauts, and you have survived the grinder the Nietzschean has put you through. As you lick your wounds in the relative safety of a Resistance haven, you are able to process how the bastard did it: as the Nietzschean moves, so does his Temple of Man. The Abyss wills it.
If you want to have a chance at defeating him, you need to negate this advantage.

A dangerous plan is set in motion. A strike team will infiltrate the heart of the empire, the very Temple of Man, to seed the unlikeliest of things: a piece of the maze of Crete, courtesy of the Temenos carcass in your cargo hold. Then, Ariadne's Anchor will root the fortress in place.
Now you need to snatch yourselves a few Spartan officials to impersonate
rulesTitle2: Infiltrate the Temple of Man

abilityText.value: Take the six Blue Clue 3B cards and shuffle the, (for now, put the six Red Clue 3B cards aside)
token, you may draw a card from this deck instead
When you have at least 4 Identity cards, during the Story Step you may see 0143 (however, you may wish to gain more Identity cards before you do that!)

name: Stand Together
flavor: As you stand on the Acropolis deck, your gaze is drawn to the heart of the empire. You've anchored the Temple of Man and you've learned of the Nietzschean's weakness. You're still not sure you can win, your forces all but depleted, but if you are to lose, you will do it together.

Preparations are well underway on a two-pronged attack: the Argo and the Titans will engage the Nietzschean monstrosity and the Spartan army around the capital, while a second, smaller strike team will once again brave the corridors of the Temple of Man, breach the Throne Room, and attack the mortal Nietzschean directly. Hopefully, he can't fight on two fronts at once.

They start coming at dawn: ships of all shapes and sizes manned by the Helots, caravans of Cyclopes numbering in the dozens, and the triremes of the grand Symmachy Diaspora Fleet. You recognize some of them as veterans of the Battle of the Fortress.
Before you can say anything, a representative of the growing refugee community on the Argo comes to you with a plea: the refugees want to fight too.
"How many?" you ask.
"All of them."
You feel your eyes water.
They have all comel They will all stand with you in the end.
Let's take down the Nietzschean together
rulesTitle: Attack the Nietzschean on two fronts. End him

abilityText.value: When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge
Immediately reveal the Temple of Man tile (018)
token on this card for each Refugee you have
tokens on this card equal to the sum of all Faction Diplomacy Bonuses
Halve the noted Resistance Strength from 2B (rounding up) and place that many additional
placed on this card represents the strength of the Resistance in the region
tokens on this card and the Argo is on the Temple of Man tile, during the Story Step you may initiate the Siege of the Temple of Man and see 0201
, you won't be able to return to the Voyage Phase!)
you have here, the stronger your allied force will be during the final confrontation!

flavor2: The time has come and you mustn't blink. Each battle and decision has led you here. The Nietzschean has a habit of asking people what they are... Show him. Break his hold and power
rulesTitle2: Time and Edge

Move the Time marker at the beginning of every Titan Round

token in the Kratos Pool (2 negative
tokens instead if you have Overwhelming Force)

During this Battle, when a Titan is about to attack, you may discard exactly 1 Support token to immediately place 1 Opening or Break token in the Kratos Pool

without any additional Attack type), see 0243
If Symmachy: Allied, the first time a Titan is about to die from a Judgement Attack, see 0245

If you've read all the rules here and in the Storybook, see 0211

name: Inward Odyssey: Abysswatchers
flavor: As you sail through Lakonia, your knowledge of the city-ship grows. Disturbing secrets and shocking revelations are brough to light and force you to reevaluate your Odyssey

21: Land of the Strong and Free

flavor2: Your Inward Odyssey continues!

abilityText.value: tokens on this card, discard them and gain +1
level, during the Story Step, after all other Story events, resolve the corresponding Inward Odyssey adventure:

name: Icarus's Plea
flavor: Delphi is a land stuck, its people hostage to the whims of the mad Oracles, repeating a cycle of death and destruction over and over again. You have come to free them from this time-locked prison, but also to realize a dream: to go back to a time before the Eschaton and to stop it from ever happening.
A noble goal or a fool's errand? You still haven't decided. Still, an endeavor worth pursuing. Imagine a world without the Eschaton.

As you reached the shores of Delphi, you were visited by the unlikeliest of creatures, Icarus, the son of the Great Inventor. Reluctantly, and with great apprehension, did he urge you to light his father's masterpieces. Before he had a chance to reveal more, he was remvoed from Argo's deck in a brilliant flash...
You need to find Icarus
rulesTitle: Find Icarus

abilityText.value: Create the Cycle III Exploration deck: find the Cycle III Exploration cards 1-9, 13, 19, 23, 29-30, 32-34 and shuffle them
Take the Cycle III Map tile 010 and place it on the board
Proceed to the first step of the Campaign Round
During the Story Step of the 6th day, see 0009

flavor2: The key to finding Icarus lies with his father's last work. The Lighthouses of Delphi have been built to withstand the ravages of time tiself and stave off the wall of void that descends upon the land, the inevitable Timefront. All they needed was the tinder to kindle the fire, one you've brought with you all the way from Crete: Ariadne's Anchor. It seems the shadow of the Great Inventor, Daedalus, is indeed long and dark.

And it begs the question: Has all of this been preordained? Are you doomed to fail and continue this vicious cycle? In Delphi there are supposedly no coincidences. But there was also no hope here, and that you have brought aplenty. Hope will see you through this storm
rulesTitle2: Re-light 5 Daedalus Lighthouses

abilityText.value: Each time you reveal a Map tile with a Daedalus Lighthouse symbol, you re-light that Lighthouse
This includes all the Map tiles you already revealed
When you reveal the 5th Lighthouse, during the Story Step, see 0017
Some Lighthouses are still standing in Delphi's Glorious Past, but to reach them, you will need the
token on this card to study the unusual temporal phenomena and the fractured land of Delphi:
: You partially reconstruct the geographical map of Delphi, immediately see 0016
This counts as 1 re-lit lighthouse for the purposes of this task

name: To Those Long Dead
flavor: Delphi is a land stuck, and Icarus a hostage to a Sun God's last will, repeating a cycle of expectations and failure over and over again.

The cycle begins. In the last days before the Eschaton, on the behest of his father, Icarus undertakes a daring mission to reach the Sun in his sky ship, the Aspirant. He doesn't make it. His ship, his crew, all is lost in the incinerating embrace of the Sun's Domain. Icarus falls. He and his crew transform into the tainted creatures plaguing Delphi. The cycle loops.

Poor Icarus keeps falling. and failing. And yet he will contineu to rise until he satisfies his father's command. Bound to repeat this vicious cycle and trap everyone else in it. And each time Delphi is a little less, consumed by the Timefront, the maw of entropy.
Icarus is bound by the Moirai to repeat his mistakes. You are not. Change the past, let Icarus soar. Cancel the Eschaton
rulesTitle: Change the timeline to help Icarus

abilityText.value: When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge
Take the six Story 2A Clue cards and shuffle them to create the
These represent the events you need to change to affect the timeline and change the fate of the Aspirant
You need to change 3 events in a Single Time Loop, otherwise you will have to repeat them
For this reason, when you are asked to mark a code in the matrix, don't put it in the Choice Matrix yet, note it separately
you resolve the Loop effect), erase those noted codes
You will only mark these in the Matrix once you see the paragraph below
They will come in handy later and will also have some immediate benefits, allowing you to choose from a wider variety of events:
: Draw another event (you still need to change only 3 events)
: Draw another event (you still need to change only 3 events)
: Draw another event (you still need to change only 3 events)
As soon as you change 3 events in a Single Time Loop, see 0059

flavor2: It should have worked. You did everything you agreed upon and events, for once, did flow differently. Yet the time loop is still here, Delphi trapped, time-locked, slowly consumed by the voracious Timefront.

Did Icarus fail or have you been deceived? Or is there something else at play here, hidden? Impossible to tell at this point. The Last Academy is tracking the descent trajectory of a near-sun object, both through time and space. The Aspirant, the sky chariot of Icarus. You need to locate it
rulesTitle2: Calculate the course of the Aspirant. Collect Progress

name: Box Of Black
flavor: The Chariot crash-landed in the outer reaches of Delphi, in the bleak future from which the Twilight Watch hails, the future you are trying to avert by stopping the Eschaton.

You've crossed the timeslip several times now, small reconnaissance missions as you look for a way to bring the Argo into the future of Delphi to look for the Aspirant. Each time, dark thoughts assail you. The ice-locked wastes are still there. Icarus's mission must have failed, and you haven't changed anything after all. The Primordials, too, are still here, more powerful than ever.
You need to find the Aspirant, the heavenly chariot, and it master and commander, Icarus. Learn what went wrong
rulesTitle: Find any chariot piece

abilityText.value: When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge
Take the three remaining Story 3A Clue cards and shuffle them to create the
You need to find a chariot piece depicted on any of the Maps you have acquired (including the one you already have)
Chariot pieces are represented on the Map tiles with the Chariot A and Chariot B symbols
The chariot pieces are scattered in the future, to which you can travel only if you have the
: Draw a card form the Chariot Map deck
: Draw a card form the Chariot Map deck
: Draw the last card form the Chariot Map deck
If the Argo is on the same Map tile as a Chariot A or Chariot B symbol, during the Story step, see 0108

flavor2: You have met with Icarus, but not the one from before. Not the merciful broken angel constantly failing to live up to expectations, but a creature strong, and cold, and calculating, one that went to the sun and came back transformed.

Uncaring and callous, this "perfected" Icarus wants to ascend to Helios's throne, to godhood, and so finally surpass his father. So it seems he is still the old Icarus: living in Daedalus's shadow, measuring his worth through the Great Inventor's pitiless eyes.

Icarus told you one more thing: The desolate Delphi you have been voyaging through is one untouched by the Eschaton. This is the future you wanted to bring back all this time. So now you know: The only way is forward.
The chase after the self-styled Sun's descendant to the Domain of Helios hidden high above Delphi, in the clouds, you will need a heaven-worthy vessel. A Chariot of your own
rulesTitle2: Locate the rest of the chariot

abilityText.value: You need to find another chariot piece, one that matches the one you have already found, so either another
tokens from side 3A onto this side (but do not draw additional Chariot Map cards for move

: Draw a card form the Chariot Map deck
: Draw the last card form the Chariot Map deck

is on the same Map tile as

An End to All Things: If, at any point, you reach the Loop End, you lose the game
Remember, you can always force a Loop effect using the

name: Trespassing
flavor: The loop is tightening. Icarus is ready to ascend the Vacant Throne, crush the Argo and Delphi along with it. You... you are not ready to be crushed just yet. As it fell, Icarus's heavenly chariot broke into pieces and has been damaged beyond repair.

Argo Works is building a new one using the parts you have salvaged, old Hyperborean tekne, and the Argo's own systems. The Phoinikos. They're certain you will be able to achieve flight, if only for a little while. A little while is all you need.
However, you're missing a crucial part, one that was destroyed a long time ago. The Argo's twilight is nigh, as its destiny looms, eager to close the circle
rulesTitle: Procure parts for the Argo

abilityText.value: When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge
Event to the Timeline X days from today
During the Story Step of that day, see 0135
If it's day 69 or earlier: 8 days
An End to All Things: If, at any point, you reach the Loop End, you lose the game
Remember, you can always force a Loop effect using the

flavor2: This is it. The final ascent.

As Phoinikos takes flight, you are reminded of all that made you embark on this journey and all that made you a beacon of hope for Hellas. For a while, you too became time-locked, not by divine power or the verdict of the Moirai, but by the alluring promise of past's embrace, of misplaced nostalgia. Yet a people looking back will never progress.
So no more of that. The only way is forward. Not to stop the Eschaton, but to rise from its ashes.
You set your course for the Sun's Domain
rulesTitle2: Reach the Sun's Domain. End this

abilityText.value: tokens on this card, discard them and gain +1

name: Law of Bargains
flavor: Pandora built a tower that holds all the curses. To topple it, you need to find it, and to find it, you need to speak with the cursed ruler of Persia. And before you can even face him, you need to stop the Empire from crushing and swallowing you whole... by becoming recognized by it, under the Law of Bargains.

In the Land Thrice-Cursed, all kneel to this Law, even the king. As the Argo sails through the sands, deeper into the Eternal Empire, you know you need to familiarize yourself with its rules too. Not to kneel, but to bend. Use it against them and buy yourselves time to search for Xerxes.
rulesTitle: Collect Progress and submit to the Law of Bargains

abilityText.value: Create the Cycle IV Exploration deck: find Cycle IV Exploration cards 1-6, 8, 9, 19, 23 and 27-37 and shuffle them
Take the Cycle IV Map cards 029, 052, and 074, randomly choose one, and return the rest
Place the chosen card on the table, then place the Argo on that card
Proceed to the first step of the Campaign Round

The first Acclimation is tied to the Law of Bargains

Each time you gain, you may place 1
tokens on this card, during the Story Step, see 0015

flavor2: You leave the palace-city posthaste; its streets, gilded with promises and the labor of the less fortunate, becoming insufferably suffocating. You have been granted a Writ of Belonging, but the writ is useless without the seal of a high Imperial official. Yet more busywork, another indirect attack against the Argo, to stall and aggravate.
You will find this Eternal Treasurer and make him stamp the Writ, of his own free will... or otherwise. You cannot waste more time.
rulesTitle2: Visit 5 Empire Treasuries and bargain with the Eternal Treasurer

name: Splendor That Beggars Belief
flavor: As newly minted citizens of the Eternal Empire, you are free to roam its vast deserts, at least nominally. With the Writ of Belonging came surprising insight into the way Xerxes rules his domain: from afar, with curses and invisible hands, hidden behind a veil of laws, procedures, and officials.
And a Wish-veil, for good measure, whatever that is.

You will pierce them all. And once you stand before this so-called God-King, you will make him loosen his grasp, on the Argo, on this ill-fated land. In Delphi, you brought down a radiant god; you can deal with a cheap imitation
rulesTitle: Find the City of Splendor

abilityText.value: When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge
If you have already advanced the Timeline past the first Acclimation, as soon as you reach Story 2A and read this, perform this Acclimation
Take the six Story 2A Clue cards, shuffle them, then, without looking, remove one and return it to the box (you won't be using it)
The remaining 5 cards form the Search for Splendor deck
Then, take the City of Splendor token, as well as 5 City of Squalor tokens, and place them near the Story card
You will place these tokens on the map
If you start the Story step on an empty
tile (one that does not have the Last Visited City token or any other tokens on it), draw a Search for Splendor card and follow its instructions
After that, if don't find the City of Splendor, place a City of Squalor token on the
tokens on this card to pay for bribes that will hasten your search:
: Without looking at it, discard 1 Clue card
: Without looking at it, discard 1 Clue card
: Without looking at it, discard 1 Clue card
\If you are ever forced to discard your last Clue card, resolve it immediately

flavor2: You could say you have pierced the Wish-veil and witnessed the true shape of things, but that would be an exaggeration. You are still chasing phantoms, though of a more pronounced shape now. The Collateral Emir escapes, and you have a hunch he will lead you to the Hanging Gardens, among the clouds, where, finally, you will face the God-King Xerxes.

His list of crimes against you--and the people of Persia--has grown considerably since you first arrived in the Thrice-Cursed Land, and if that is any indication of how things were before, it may truly be infinite. Is there even a punishment severe enough for one so guilty?
rulesTitle2: Chase the Collateral Emir's cloud ship!

abilityText.value: You will find the full rules of the chase in paragraph 0093
Keep the storybook open; you'll be referring to it often!
If you located the Hanging Gardens, place their marker on the indicated Map tile
is on the same Map tile as the Hanging Gardens marker, during the Story Step, see 1112

name: The Rope Sellers
flavor: The Hanging Gardens turned out to be a dead end, which, in a sense, is par for the course for your voyage across the Land Thrice-Cursed. It is as if the people here have mad eit their trade to lie and obfuscate, to the point where nothing seems truly real anymore, not even your ship and its mission.
You are the Argonauts, though, and you do not simply quit. You will struggle against adversity until your very last breaths, so long as there is even the tiniest thread to follow.

And that is why you embark on a search for the Graves of the Anemoi, the source of the counterweight gas that literally keeps the Eternal Empire afloat. Maybe it is the missing link to Pandora's Jar. Maybe it will become a weapon against it. Maybe.
It is something, at least
rulesTitle: Look for information about the Graves of the Anemoi

abilityText.value: When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge
Check the following Map tiles in order and stop as soon as you arrive at a Map tile not already explored
That is the Map tile where the Old Refinery City is located
The Map tiles you check (in order) are:
If, for some reason, you have explored all of these Map tiles, you can choose which one of them has the Old Refinery City (do it now)
tokens on this card, and you are on the Old Refinery City Map tile, during the Story Step, see 1207

flavor2: After a quick stop at a rundown refinery city--even its name eludes you now--you have learned the coordinates of the closest active deposit of the subterranean conterweight gas. A Grave of the Anemoi, if you believe the legends.

You have also witnessed the wasting effects the gas has on those who have handled it, and the remorseless attitude the Eternal Empire has toward those who are no longer useful to it, loyal citizens or not.
You set off toward the Grave
rulesTitle2: Travel to the Grave of the Anemoi

abilityText.value: You will find the full rules of this Story in paragraph 1211 (the same paragraph that directed you to take this card)
In short, you need to travel to a Grave of the Anemoi
There are several on the Map, but some are exhausted, not eligible--if you're not sure which, check the aformentioned paragraph
is on the same Map tile as an active Grave of the Anemoi, during the Story Step, see 1331

name: A Mortal's Reach
flavor: The mural at the Grave of the Anemoi had a transformative effect, illuminating that which was previously hidden from you. It hel a deeper truth still, some kind of cipher, but this newfound knowledge was quite enough for you to go on. The veil of deceit is coming apart at the seams. You just have to pull at it a little while longer
rulesTitle: Collect Progress to ponder on what you have realized, or see beyond it

abilityText.value: When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge (see rules)
tokens on this card, flip it

flavor2: The Tower of Pandora has goaded you from the moment you set foot in Persia, always there, in the corner of your eye, ready to appear at a moment's notice to dispense its curses.

You did not deserve it, just as the peoples of Persian have done nothing to deserve the yoke of Infinite Growth. And yet, you both allowed yourselves to be deceived into believing that you had. Into self-loathing. Into guilt. Into debt.
No more.
Today, the tower falls, and growth stops
rulesTitle2: Reach Pandora's Jar

(Warning: This is a Point of No Return; you won't be able to return to the Voyage Phase beyond this point)

name: Inward Odyssey: Gardens of Infinite Growth
name2: Inward Odyssey: Gardens of Infinite Growth

abilityText.value: tokens on this card, discard them and gain +1
level, during the Story Step, after all other Story events, resolve the corresponding Inward Odyssey adventure:

name: What Remains?
flavor: You came to the Cyclades to realize the late Old Priest's plan. Bring hope to its people and put an end to the threat of the long Eschaton once and for all. Free Hellas from the shackles of the gods, Primordials, and black ambrosia in one fell swoop.

It took years to finally get here. THousands have come and gone from the Argo in the meantime, conscripts and refugees from Crete, Sparta, Delphi, Persia, and all the other disparate places you have not visited, but which have heard about you and your mission, and decided to throw their lots with the Odyssey.

The list of the decorated and the dead covers many steles of the Heroon. Countless nameless Titans have been killed in action, the only evidence of their existence the notches on the walls of the Titan Stoa. So many notches.
Challenges overcome. Empires toppled. Tyrants slain. Sacrifices made and paid in full. Lifetimes of struggle.
For it all to spectacularly fail before your eyes. For it to cause untold devastation and make things worse. To unleash a monster that could drown the world in flames. Ur-Fleece.
Without recourse, without a plan, you are left to ask: what remains?
rulesTitle: Discard Progress and help the people of the Cyclades deal with the Disaster, as you look for the Virtuary

abilityText.value: Create the Cycle V Exploration deck by finding the Cycle V Exploration cards 1-6, 8, 9, 19, 23, 29, and 31-36 and shuffling them
Then, take the Cycle V Map card
and place it, surface face up, on the table, then place the
Proceed to the first step of the Campaign Round
If there are no more tokens on this card, see 0028
You may discard tokens from this card only if the Last Visited City token is on the Map, on a surface City

flavor2: A decade ago, the Protectorate emerged as the major power of the Cyclades, putting an end to years of lawlessness and religious strife. They promised safety and prosperity. Today, the archipelago is nothing but. Today, their control is slipping.

You travel the Great Sea, bringing relief to the victims of the Disaster, straddling the divide between the Protectorate and the Vanguard of Atlantis, returning to claim what they perceive is their birthright. Ever on the lookout for the Virtuary, who many call "Truthsayer," and whom the Truth Machine marked as the only one who can stop Ur-Fleece.
Behind you, the Nemesis. Ahead of you, a conflict with the Symmachy who wish to take the Argo away
rulesTitle2: Discard Progress and help the people of the Cyclades deal with the Disaster, as you look for the Virtuary

abilityText.value: If the Nemesis has not yet entered play, place the
If there are no more tokens on this card, see 0039
You may discard tokens from this card only if the Last Visited City token is on the Map, on a surface City

name: The Enemy of My Enemy
flavor: On the shores of Ios, an old foe has reappeared. For once, you have gained the upper hand, thanks to an unlikely ally, who you believe to have been the Virtuary. Few would doubt the near-prophetic words of the Truth Machine.

Yet the encounter has opened old wounds and sowed fear among the crew. Against your wishes, stories of a fabled refuge called "Unknown Delos" spread in hushed whispers. Though you understand the weariness and the desire ot finally lay down arms, you will not abandon your mission to look for something... that may not even exist.
Unlike myths, you now know the Virtuary is a man of blood and bones, and men leave trails
rulesTitle: Find someone who can lead you to the Virtuary

abilityText.value: When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge
on this card, during the Story Step, see 0911

flavor2: With the Nemesis spreading their holy terror and Ur-Fleece boiling the seas, the Cyclades once again drown in fear. Many await a promised Truthsayer to come and wash away their grief and pain in one tidal wave of truth, and many seize this opportunity to proclaim themselves prophet. The Punished was only the beginning.
Another, arguably, is the Virtuary, though you believe him to be different. The Machine marked him. He is the key to defeating Ur-Fleece and quelling the rising flames...

And you finally know where to find him. White Haven, a hidden Followers of Arete hermitage, whose trappings purposefully tap into the imagery of the mythical refuge of Unknown Delos. The Virtuary is supposed to be there, making an address to his inner circle.
Now... you just need to locate it
rulesTitle2: Find the location of 'White Haven'

abilityText.value: If you start the Story Step on an Underwater
tile that does not have the Last Visited Underwater City token or any other tokens on it, see 0577
During this Story card, if you wish, you may place additional

name: Quietly Into the Night
flavor: At Eusebes, the Follower hermitage of White Haven, you have found only ghosts and death... and the Last Hierei's desire. He is not interested in you or the Argo at all, but rather in what it currently holds: the Truth Machine, which he thinks is the genuine article, not a Mnestis-generated simulacrum. He believes it will tell him how to bring Poseidon back from the dead. "A priest should never drink his own poison," says Jason. "HIs faith is his weakness, which we might yet exploit..."

The Argo is not the only lead the Last Heirei is following. There once was an original Truth Machine, remember, one lost with the fall of Anostos, Atlantis's capital. Now that the metropolis is rumored to have been reclaimed, others will soon find their way there.
You need to get there before the Nemesis does
rulesTitle: Collect Progress and find Anostos, the fallen capital of Atlantis

abilityText.value: When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge
You now have a Phos Map that supposedly leads to the capital of Atlantis
You need to find the tile shown on that Map card
: Gain another, random Story 3A Clue card (cards 3AA-3AF)
: Check your Phos Map cards for deatils on new actions

If you start the Story Step on a tile you think is the correct one, match the clue form the card to the clue on the tile to find a paragraph number! If you are correct, place the Atlantean Capital marker on your tile and proceed to the appropriate paragraph
Important: Be sure you're ready for what is to come

flavor2: You went to Anostos to stop the Last Hierei from finding a way to awaken his dead god, Poseidon. Needlessly. For he is already on his way. Has been, since that fateful night on Thera. Thanks to you.

The Last Hierei does not know. Yet. He will, once he gets his hands on the Argo and the Truth Machine. You can't go against him and his indominable ship, the Nemesis, alone. You hate to admit it, but... you need help. You need the Symmachy
rulesTitle2: Rendezvous with the Symmachy fleet

abilityText.value: If the Doom card number is lower than the Story card number, during the Doom Step, flip or archive the current Doom card, triggering any relevant paragraph
Event to the Timeline X days from today
During the Story Step of that day, see 2407
If it's day 39 or earlier: 20 days
for this Story! However, if you wish, you may place additional

name: The Sleep of Reason
flavor: You have left the Symmachy fleet behind, and with it any notion that they will help you. No one will. Poseidon is waking. Unbeknownst, the Last Hierei comes for you to hasten his return.

You last hope is to hide. Remove yourselves from the world, so the Last Hierei never claims the damned thing. There is only one place in the whole Cyclades where one might find shelter from all harm, a mythical refuge. Unknown Delos.
If it exists. If you can find your way to it
rulesTitle: Find Unknown Delos

abilityText.value: When this card is revealed, perform a Divine Surge
If the Doom card number is lower than 3, during the Doom Step, flip or archive the current Doom card, triggering any relevant paragraph
Take the seven 4A Clue cards and shuffle them
, a tile with a Ruins token on it, or a Silver Remnant
, during the Story Step, draw an Unknown Delos card and place a Generic token on the visited location to mark it as searched (you cannot gain any more Unknown Delos card from that tile)
The Unknown Delos cards will reveal to you the place you need to go--a paragraph number
When you know the number, simply proceed to it
The paragraph you're looking for will be marked be a
This is a Point of No Return

flavor2: You sought Unknown Delos, and, after much struggle, you have found it. You wish you haven't. There is no refuge. Never was. Not for the Silver People. Not for you. Not even for the god-in-tatters. Just fairy tales to help children sleep at night.

There is... nothing for you to do now. Nowhere to run, or hide. With a myriad foes around you, with a ship that is at this very moment failing, you stand no chance of facing even the pale shadow of Ur-Fleece.
What remains?
You are the Argonauts. You will go out the same way you lived: swinging
rulesTitle2: Help the Cycladeans for as long as you can and go out swinging

abilityText.value: If the Doom card number is lower than 3B, during the Doom Step, flip or archive the current Doom card, triggering any relevant paragraph

name: Inward Odyssey: Truthsayer
flavor: As you sail through the Cyclades, you begin to piece it all together

abilityText.value: tokens on this card, discard them and gain +1
level, during the Story Step, after all other Story events, resolve the corresponding Inward Odyssey adventure:

name: Have it
flavor: It was always there, at the very bottom, beyond the dark, the doubt, and the despair, waiting for you to rekindle it.
Hope.

Hope to quench the fires, destroy Poseidon and honor a legacy. Everything you need to end it you either already know, possess or will find onboard your sister-ship, the Nemesis. Whose leader is singularly obsessed with something you have. The Truth Machine.
So... why not take a cue from Odysseus's Trojan playbook?.
And give it to him
rulesTitle: Reach the _Nemesis_ and get yourselves 'eaten' by the gargantuan warship

flavor2: The Last Hierei finally got to meet his maker.

You? You are on your way to the Dark Below, the deepest trench of the Great Sea, where the carcass of Poseidon rots, not quite as dead as you would have hoped. It needs a little push. The payload you've liberated from the Nemesis should remedy that.
Without the 13th Muse Grand Cannon, you have no delivery mechanism... save for the Argo itself. Your crew begins to evacuate.
One way or another, this is your final voyage
rulesTitle2: Find Ur-Fleece and end it
